intro: Canhamo braziliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian canhamo, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom in vibrant colors. The plant has hairy, ovate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found near water sources. Due to its ecological importance and unique appearance, it is a subject of interest in botanical research.
